title: Doc Blanchard
summary: Felix Anthony "Doc" Blanchard (December 11, 1924 â€“ April 19, 2009) was best known as the college football player who became the first junior to win the Heisman Trophy, Maxwell Award and was the first football player to win the James E. Sullivan Award, all in 1945. He played football for the United States Military Academy at West Point, where he was known as "Mr. Inside." Because his father was a doctor, Felix Blanchard was nicknamed "Little Doc" as a boy.[1] After football, he served in the United States Air Force from 1947 until 1971 when he retired with the rank of colonel.
